user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_DirOpen_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_DirOpen_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, const char *local_path)
{
    DIR *                          dp = opendir(local_path);
    OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t *impl;

    if (dp == NULL)
    {
        return OS_ERROR;
    }

    impl     = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_dir_table, *token);
    impl->dp = dp;

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_DirOpen_Impl:
typedef struct
{
    DIR *dp;
} OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
extern OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t OS_impl_dir_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_DIRS]
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
DIR *                          dp = opendir(local_path);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated: dp is a pointer to an opaque DIR object returned by opendir and is stored in OS_impl_dir_table as DIR*. POSIX directory APIs (readdir, closedir, etc.) and the existing table expect DIR*, so the pointer cannot reasonably be const-qualified here. (It would be a violation only if the pointed-to object were never modified and all uses accepted const DIR*, which is not the case.)
